DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication of the source of a laboratory specimen/biospecimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._Where something is available or from where it originates.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
Where something is available or from where it originates.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Where something is available or from where it originates.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to a ventricle (of the heart or brain).

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to a ventricle (of the heart or brain).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The area of the body below the ribs and above the hipbones.

Concepts.definition: The region of the spine below the ribs and above the hipbones.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:Where something is available or from where it originates.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
Where something is available or from where it originates.
